brief_summary.textblock:
Abnormal vaginal flora is a risk factor for preterm labor. Therefore, in high risk
      pregnancies for preterm labor the diagnosis and treatment of abnormal flora is indicated.
      Clindamycin and metronidazole given orally are both acceptable treatments in these cases.
      The purpose of this study is to compare the effectiveness of Clindamycin Vs metronidazole
      for the treatment of abnormal vaginal flora in high risk pregnancies. For this purpose,
      pregnant women who are considered high risk for preterm labor and were diagnosed with
      abnormal vaginal flora will be randomly treated either with clindamycin or metronidazole.
      Eradication of the abnormal flora and adverse effects will be monitored and compared

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison Between Oral Clindamycin Vs Metronidazole for the Treatment of Abnormal Vaginal Flora in High Risk Pregnancies
condition: High Risk Pregnancies for Preterm Labor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnant women at increased risk for preterm labor (preterm cervical effacement,
             preterm uterine contractions, twins pregnancy, vaginal bleeding, past preterm
             delivery)

          -  Age above 18 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Known allergy to the tested antibiotics

          -  Antibacterial treatment in the week before the vaginal culture was taken

          -  preterm premature rupture of membranes

intervention.description: Oral clindamycin 300 Milligrams*2/Day for a week
Oral metronidazole 500 Milligrams*2/Day for a week

keyword: High risk pregnancies for preterm labor

facility.name: Departement of obstetric and gynecology, HaEmek medical center

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison Between Oral Clindamycin Vs Metronidazole for the Treatment of Abnormal Vaginal Flora in High Risk Pregnancies

overall_official.affiliation: Departement of obstetric and gynecology, HaEmek medical center, Afula, Israel

oversight_info.authority: Israel: department of obstetric and gynecology, HaEmek Medical Center

primary_outcome.measure: To compare the efficacy between oral Clindamycin Vs Metronidazole in the eradication of abnormal vaginal flora
primary_outcome.time_frame: Primary outcome will be assessed by taking a vaginal culture sample a week after one-week antibacterial treatment

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the antibacterial treatment which is 1 week of therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: The prevalence of late abortions and preterm deliveries
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date of delivery or abortion, assessed up to 28 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessing the correlation between Nugent score , physical examination and Ph indicators
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome is assessed after the diagnosis of abnormal vaginal flora is made at 14-26 weeks of gestation

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
